intro: Micropholis sericea, commonly known as silverleaf micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Micropholis sericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
